topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1 Alpha: Installation Troubleshooting

body.p: This topic describes all the known issues that you might encounter:
body.section:
Node fails to boot during HLM provision System Behavior/Message
In rare situations, a node might not boot during the HLM provisioning process due to an issue with network configuration.
Resolution If this happens, log into that console. If you see a message stating that the boot failed at network configuration, use the Retry Auto Configuration option to attempt a re-boot. It might take more than one attempt to get the node to boot.

section.title: Installation fails due to Ansible errors
section.p: The installation fails during hlm deploy, and you see any of the following errors:

ul.li: Any error with the following message: Failed to launch the accelerated daemon on 10.10.2.102 (reason: failed to connect to the local socket file) . For example:GATHERING FACTS *************************************************************** fatal: [BASE-CCP-T1-M1-NETCLM] => Failed to launch the accelerated daemon on 10.10.2.102 (reason: failed to connect to the local socket file) ok: [BASE-CCP-T1-M2-NETCLM] ok: [BASE-CCP-T1-M3-NETCLM]

Any error that contains the "OSError: [Errno 17] File exists: '/root/.fireball.keys'" string. For example:fatal: [BASE-CCP-T1-M1-NETCLM] => Traceback (most recent call last): . . . OSError: [Errno 17] File exists: '/root/.fireball.keys'

section.p: These are errors internal to Ansible and are random in occurrence.

If you experience one of these errors on any tiers except the HP Helion OpenStack controller tiers (which is T1 in the Denver deployment and T2 in Tahoe, Memphis and Sacramento deployments), do the following:

ol.li: Kill the ansible run if its still going on using Ctrl C.
Execute the following from the lifecycle manager to remove the Ansible accelerate daemon, which runs on the nodes:hlm deploy -c <cloudname> -t accelerate-mode
Execute the following command to restart the installation:hlm deploy -c <cloudname> -r

section.p: If you hit this issue at the very beginning of the HP Helion OpenStack controller tiers (which is T1 in the Denver deployment and T2 in Tahoe, Memphis and Sacramento deployments), before the FND-MDB or the FND-RMQ roles have run, do the following:

ol.li: Kill the ansible run if its still going on using Ctrl C.
Execute the following from the lifecycle manager to remove the Ansible accelerate daemon, which runs on the nodes:hlm deploy -c <cloudname> -t accelerate-mode
Execute the following command to restart the installation:hlm deploy -c <cloudname> -r

section.p: If you hit this issue at HP Helion OpenStack controller tiers (which is T1 in the Denver deployment and T2 in Tahoe, Memphis and Sacramento deployments), after the FND-MDB or the FND-RMQ roles have run, follow the steps in Scenario 1.

section.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation (hlm deploy) fails at the Reload apache2 configuration task
section.p: The installation of HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade (the hlm deploy command) fails, with the following message:

ol.li: Execute the following command on each controller to restart apache2: service apache2 restart
Execute the following command on the lifecycle manager to restart the installation:hlm deploy -c <cloud_name> -r"

section.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation (hlm deploy) fails at the install ntp client task

body.p: The installation of HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade (the hlm deploy command) fails, with the following message:TASK: [Install ntp client] **************************************************** Failed to launch the accelerated daemon on 10.200.187.105 (reason: failed to connect to the local socket file) FATAL: all hosts have already failed – aborting

ol.li: Execute the following command on all nodes that failed, to disable firewall: ufw disable
Execute the following from the lifecycle manager to remove the Ansible accelerate daemon, which runs on the nodes:hlm deploy -c <cloudname> -t accelerate-mode
Execute the following command to restart the installation:hlm deploy -c b30 -r

section.title: Installation fails at Ansible playbook
section.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation fails during the HLM deployment (after executing the ansible-playbook command) with an error similar to the following.
section.codeblock: TASK: [HLM-CREATE-ON-BM | Add hlm to the in-memory inventory of playbook] ***** ok: [192.168.122.1] PLAY [hlm] ********************************* GATHERING FACTS ***************************** previous known host file not found fatal: [192.168.122.240] => SSH encountered an unknown error during the connection. We recommend you re-run the command using -vvvv, which will enable SSH debugging output to help diagnose the issue TASK: [HLM-CFG | Delete existing interfaces file] ***************************** FATAL: no hosts matched or all hosts have already failed -- aborting PLAY RECAP ******************************************************************** to retry, use: --limit @/root/setup_hlm_onBM.retry 192.168.122.1 : ok=18 changed=8 unreachable=0 failed=0 192.168.122.240 : ok=0 changed=0 unreachable=1 failed=0

ol.li: Execute the following command to determine if the HLM VM was created: virsh list –allIf the HLM VM appears in the output, delete the VM using the following commands:virsh destroy hlm virsh undefined hlm

Edit the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/setup_hlm_onBM.yml file to comment the second role. The file contains two roles: the first one creates the VM and the second one configures the VM. hosts: hlm_kvm_host sudo: yes user: root roles: HLM-CREATE-ON-BM hosts: hlm #sudo: yes #user: root #roles: HLM-CFG
Again, run the ansible-playbook –i hosts setup_hlm_onBM.yml.
After the command completes, execute the following command to obtain the vibr0 IP address for the HLMarp | grep aaCopy the IP address you get in the output. 192.168.122.XXX

Edit the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/hosts file to add the vibr0 IP address in the following manner: [vsd] 10.10.10.10 ansible_ssh_user=root ansible_ssh_pass=Alcateldc
[hlm] 192.168.122.240 ansible_ssh_user=root ansible_ssh_pass=cghelion
[hlm_kvm_host] 192.168.122.1 #ansible_ssh_user=root ansible_ssh_pass=root

Edit the setup_hlm_onBM.yml to comment-out the first role and un-comment the second role. hosts: hlm_kvm_host sudo: yes user: root roles: - HLM-CREATE-ON-BM hosts: hlm sudo: yes user: root roles: HLM-CFG

section.title: VM fails to get private/Fixed IP address
section.p: After configuring the VRS-G during installation, the VRS-G VM is assigned with private and floating IP ddress, when seen on the VSD dashboard. However, if you launch a console session to the VM, there is no networking.
Make sure the Glance image has the correct properties set. For example, check that the adapter type is ide. Also, check if gateway and subnet values are correctly assigned to VRSvAPPs.

section.title: VRSvAPPs missing in VSD dashboard
section.p: While performing basic verification of cloud deployment, the VRSvAPPs might not appear in the VSD dashboard and the associated TUL addresses are not pingable from VRS-G node.
This issue occurs if the VRSvAPP is not configured correctly.
Make sure all properties are populated corectly for the VRSvAPP VMs running in the ESX environment. Make sure there is a one-to-one mapping between each ESX host and a VRSvAPP.

section.title: See Also
section.p: For troubleshooting tips related to the HP Helion OpenStack cloud, see HP Helion OpenStack: Troubleshooting.
